p: Campylobacter spp. are on the World Health Organization (WHO) list of global priority pathogens for research and development of new antibiotics [ 14]. Several antibiotics are no longer effective in the clinical treatment of campylobacteriosis, so new antibiotics and novel treatment schemes are needed [ 15]. In this context, medicinal plants are promising in isolating candidate molecules for new drugs [ 16], since phytochemicals are a major source of bioactive compounds with potent antimicrobial activities [ 17].
